bjad.common.string

Class SecureString

  • java.lang.Object
    • bjad.common.string.SecureString

  • public class SecureString
extends Object
    Wrapper for keeping strings secured by encrypting them in memory, or to decrypt/encrypt strings from setting files or other external sources.
    Author:
    Ben Dougall

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SecureString()
      Creates an empty secure string with a randomized key and salt value.
      SecureString(String value)
      Creates a securestring for the value passed using a randomized key and salt value.
      SecureString(String key, String salt)
      Creates an empty Secure String but sets the encryption key and the salting value for future operations.
      SecureString(String key, String salt, String value)
      Creates the secure string with the key, salt, and initial value set within it.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getBase64String()
      Returns the base64 string for the encrypted string in the object.
      String getString()
      Provides the string stored securely within the object.
      boolean setFromBase64String(String base64String)
      Sets the encrypted value within the object from the base 64 value passed to the function.
      void setString(String value)
      Sets the string value that is to be stored securely in the object.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SecureString

        public SecureString()
        Creates an empty secure string with a randomized key and salt value.

      • SecureString

        public SecureString(String value)
        Creates a securestring for the value passed using a randomized key and salt value. Useful for securely storing a password or sensitive information during the runtime for the application.
        Parameters:
        value - The string to encrypt.

      • SecureString

        public SecureString(String key,
                    String salt)
        Creates an empty Secure String but sets the encryption key and the salting value for future operations.
        Parameters:
        key - The encryption key to use. If empty, the key will be randomized.
        salt - The salting value to use. If empty, the salt value will be randomized.

      • SecureString

        public SecureString(String key,
                    String salt,
                    String value)
        Creates the secure string with the key, salt, and initial value set within it.
        Parameters:
        key - The encryption key to use. If empty, the key will be randomized.
        salt - The salting value to use. If empty, the salt value will be randomized.
        value - The string to store securely within the object.

    • Method Detail

      • getString

        public String getString()
                 throws SecureStringException
        Provides the string stored securely within the object.
        Returns:
        The actual string stored in the object.
        Throws:
        SecureStringException - Any encryption exceptions will be thrown. If the value if coming from an external source, the calling function should be catching for this exception in case the value set was invalid.

      • setString

        public void setString(String value)
               throws SecureStringException
        Sets the string value that is to be stored securely in the object.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to store securely.
        Throws:
        SecureStringException - Any encryption exceptions will be thrown.

      • getBase64String

        public String getBase64String()
        Returns the base64 string for the encrypted string in the object.
        Returns:
        The base 64 string of the encrypted value, or empty string if nothing is stored.

      • setFromBase64String

        public boolean setFromBase64String(String base64String)
        Sets the encrypted value within the object from the base 64 value passed to the function.
        Parameters:
        base64String - The base 64 to decode and store in the object
        Returns:
        True if the base 64 string could be decoded and stored, false otherwise.
